commits.message: Add UI button component and utility functions
commits.author: Phineas Kibbey
commits.shortDiff:
commit fd3b4e3637bad398e1666ef3819f75c7f4e418ba
Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 22 17:23:35 2025 +0000

    Add UI button component and utility functions
    
    Introduces a reusable Button component with multiple variants and sizes using class-variance-authority and Radix UI Slot. Adds a utility function for merging Tailwind and clsx classes. Updates globals.css for new color variables, theme support, and animation imports. Adds required dependencies and configuration for UI components.

days.aiSummary: Today's development focused on establishing the foundational UI structure for Peak Blooms, with the introduction of a reusable button component and essential utility functions. This work lays the groundwork for a consistent and efficient user interface, leveraging modern libraries for componentization and styling.
keyDecisions: Adopted `class-variance-authority` for component styling to enable flexible and performant UI implementation.
Integrated `Radix UI Slot` for enhanced component extensibility and customization within the button component.
Implemented a utility function using `clsx` to streamline class management for Tailwind CSS, promoting code maintainability.
learnings: Gained practical experience integrating the `ui` schema from `shadcn-ui` to establish a consistent component library structure for Peak Blooms.
Understood the benefits of using `class-variance-authority` for creating performant and flexible components with encapsulated styling.
Learned how to effectively utilize `Radix UI Slot` to create more adaptable and extensible UI components.

architecturalCallouts.title: Component-Based UI with `shadcn-ui`
architecturalCallouts.description: The adoption of `shadcn-ui` and the `components.json` file demonstrates a clear architectural decision to build Peak Blooms as a collection of reusable, well-styled components. This promotes modularity, maintainability, and code reusability, aligning with best practices for modern web application development. The use of `shadcn-ui`'s schema ensures a consistent and scalable UI library.

architecturalCallouts.title: Utility-First Styling with Tailwind CSS and `clsx`
architecturalCallouts.description: The decision to leverage Tailwind CSS for styling, combined with the `clsx` utility function, reflects a focus on a utility-first approach. This promotes efficient styling without writing custom CSS, leading to faster development cycles and improved code maintainability. The `clsx` function enhances this by providing a convenient way to manage conditional styling.

architecturalCallouts.title: Optimized Component Styling with `class-variance-authority`
architecturalCallouts.description: `class-variance-authority` was chosen to optimize component styling for performance. By enabling the efficient composition of styles based on component state and props, it minimizes unnecessary CSS and contributes to faster rendering. This is crucial for a smooth user experience in Peak Blooms.

architecturalCallouts.title: Leveraging Radix UI for Component Extensibility
architecturalCallouts.description: The incorporation of `Radix UI Slot` highlights a learning in leveraging specialized UI libraries for enhancing component flexibility. This demonstrates an understanding of how to utilize external tools to improve the design and development process, particularly for aspects requiring dynamic content or customizable layouts within the button component.
